description:
Valkey, the Redis fork, is kicking rump and taking names. At Open Source Summit Europe, the Linux Foundation announced the release of Valkey 8.0, a giant step forward to the open-source in-memory NoSQL data store. This release focuses on enhancing performance, reliability, and observability, marking a major milestone for the project initially forked from Redis […]

The post Valkey 8 Sets a New Bar for Open-Source In-Memory NoSQL Data Storage appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Valkey 8 Sets a New Bar for Open-Source In-Memory NoSQL Data Storage

description:
The latest 6.11 kernel release is here! This release improves performance, security, and hardware compatibility, increasing the kernel’s flexibility and efficiency for various computing environments.

The post Kernel 6.11: Power Moves and Hardware Grooves appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Kernel 6.11: Power Moves and Hardware Grooves

description:
Zorin OS 17.2 launches with customizable desktops, enhanced security features, and better app behavior.

The post Zorin OS 17.2: Faster, More Secure, and User-Friendly appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Zorin OS 17.2: Faster, More Secure, and User-Friendly

description:
New Proton 9.0-3 update: Play games like Avatar, Ball at Work, Super, Flatout 3, and many others on Linux with improved stability and support.

The post Proton 9.0-3 Unleashes New Playable Titles and Essential Fixes appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Proton 9.0-3 Unleashes New Playable Titles and Essential Fixes
